Will Tech Products Need to Work at Higher Temperatures Due to Climate Change?
text:
Recently, there was a heatwave in Europe, with various places there having higher temperatures than ever before. During this heatwave, lots of articles were published about the maximum temperature devices like the Nintendo Switch could operate in, with Nintendo saying the system could overheat if played in places hotter than 35 degrees celsius.

So this made me wonder something... will max temperature requirements for future pieces of tech (like games consoles, computers, etc) be higher in future to deal with rising temperatures due to climate change? Will say, future iPads and Macbooks be designed to work in 40-50 degree temperatures so that people without air conditioning/those working outside can still use them on hot days?

Or is there some technical reason this can't be the case?

Ask HN: Email service for tiny company, 20 users, no marketing, no transactional
text:
What email service would you recommend for my tiny company? I need to send and receive emails from personname@mydomain.com, about 20 user accounts, catchall (so that all emails to unknownuser@mydomain.com come to say catchall@domain.com), where price is not per account but per domain with unlimited or large number of accounts. No need for marketing campaigns or transactional emails from the SAAS we got, we have a solution for that.

UPDATE: a useful article, mentioning some of the services mentioned in the comments to my question, and to a similar question(https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=32522919)

I would ideally have an email service separate from my domain web hosting. I would also need more than a couple of accounts some of the services provide (e.g. ZOHO)

title: Apple Car: Software and Money
Ask HN: How is international (Unicode) email address support in 2022?
text:
Playing with IDN domain names, I had several problems with services supporting such email address:

- Gmail doesn't allow me reply to a friend's email, though they could send to me - GitHub would 500 out when adding a GPG key with a UID with Unicode email address - Some services can't outright send the email to such an address

A thread from 2017 https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=14831756 and one from 2019 https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=19013617 showed that the support was poor. I wonder how it is in 2022?

title: Don't try this at home: overclocking RP2040 to 1GHz
The Invisible White Empire
Ask HN: Is AI goal to make most people dumb/the same?
text:
Over the last decade I’ve noticed that people are preferring to learn from videos and podcasts instead of reading books or actually doing the foundational work. It’s becoming even more apparent each year that we get interns. Many have weak foundational knowledge and these are folks from top 20 colleges. They also don’t want to get advice from anyone, preferring to google their way through everything taking the first solution the results give without taking the effort to understand the why or how. Even people my age or older seem to be getting slower and repeat the same talking points or bike shedding topics that were trending.

Just ten years ago the people I would meet would have so many different things they’re into even if they’re in the same broader work or hobby group. Like we could all be into roasting coffee, and then we all have our unique individual interests.

Now people just discuss the stuff that’s trending on social media or other tools that aggregate data. They disregard the advice or inputs of people around them, preferring to get an answer from the collective recommendations. It seems to make people act and behave kind of the same, and honestly it’s kind of scary.
